46AB765411E247D592E50D9141B5D279.description:
Every disciple of Jesus Christ has a responsibility to serve
those in need through corporal and spiritual works of mercy.

F0F660112B5B40C18419216C75AB0215.description:
The Magisterium has given us guidance in the form of encyclicals
and letters to help us live just lives.

F0E421A371FA440B9D7AF96E9BED16A1.description:
The Church gives us 7 points of Social Teaching by which to model
our lives.

FD35EB28B37243CC9DE750CA7A1D5B28.description:
The Saints provide us with examples of how to live justly and with
compassion for others.

D568F17D1A994879A4619C1ADD9D60CF.description: The Old Testament and New Testament both contain scriptural stories that guide the faithful in living lives of justice and mercy.

ED20986757014A9499AA6D45B191C787.description: The message of justice and mercy in the Beatitudes is central to the New Covenant.

D0AB4A89EDD34FA4B6C3BB4E57D43C18.description:
JESUS CHRIST TAUGHT US HOW TO TREAT ONE ANOTHER WITH JUSTICE AND MERCY IN ORDER TO TRULY LIVE AS HIS
DISCIPLES.

76759C89B7D442AFADECD1710491F8D2.description: The liturgy has undergone changes throughout the history of the Church in order to better serve the needs of the faithful.

2B77C0B1BF3248D9A57F822F8ACC6299.description:
The Seven Sacraments are celebrated as part of the Liturgical work of the Church and help the faithful to lead lives directed
towards Jesus Christ.

7D4C1B7210F8413FB97754D33F92517B.description:
The Bishop calls the faithful to "full, active and conscious participation" in the Liturgy; especially, the Sunday
Eucharistic Celebration, the central liturgical action of the
faithful.

8745FC279C2A434694D9A12563F4A2C1.description:
The Church marks time with a Liturgical Calendar, in order to
sanctify our days.

2D0A10EC62CE42818F3705B75722C230.description:
The laity, consecrated religious and ordained ministers are called to join in the work and prayer of the Liturgy of the
Hours. The Liturgy of the Hours is the daily public prayer of the
Church, prayed at regular intervals throughout the day.

92F0805C1BE0467CA1BC69E2EA997E02.description: LITURGY IS THE PUBLIC WORK OF THE BODY OF JESUS CHRIST, THE CHURCH.

76E3605377294C929D852CE04651074F.description:
Through the events of the Last Supper and the encounter on the Road to Emmaus the relationship to the Old Testament covenant
becomes apparent.

74468885C93B4EBB85F161B35E82CDFC.description:
The covenant of the New Testament is a fulfillment of the Old
Testament covenant.

E0322A67617C410A9A5C5288EA4B188B.description: JESUS FULFILLS THE OLD COVENANT BY MAKING A NEW COVENANT WITH US.

E6EBF095003E471B84F12C70869AB81D.description: The Passion of our Lord Jesus Christ can be found in all four Gospels.

6E7ACDB6003540449FB8ECF6F3682EE3.description: The four Gospels proclaim the Good News of Jesus Christ's life, death, and resurrection.

B31F52AFC66A46979D7CDF727F3A6B0A.description: The eight beatitudes form part of the teaching given by Jesus during the Sermon on the Mount which sets forth fundamental attitudes and virtues for living as a faithful disciple.

B2BC7F4D26B14F8FA69B90D757FBD310.description: John the Baptist is the last prophet before the coming of Jesus Christ, bearing witness to the fulfillment of the Old Testament promise of a Messiah.

A9D859D3AC4A4B0B9B79856AAE2189C2.description: THE NEW TESTAMENT PROVIDES AN ACCOUNT OF THE SAVING ACTIONS OF JESUS CHRIST (HIS LIFE, DEATH AND I RESURRECTION).

BB9F415A62FE4F78BB460F22CEE94883.description:
The Prophets relate to the three-fold mission of Jesus Christ (Priest,
Prophet and King) and to the call to baptism.

EA1F9DB4F11F41B6BA96218FBD403363.description: There are Christocentric themes in the books of Isaiah, Malachi, Ezekiel, Daniel and in the other prophets.

ECB5C67229A743FA8836814887F59689.description:
The Prophets are divided into two groups: Major Prophets and Minor
Prophets.

F0BA9DD9CC004BAA90177F5525553221.description:
THE PROPHETS CALLED GOD'S PEOPLE BACK TO FAITHFULNESS TO THE COVENANT AND FORETOLD THE COMING OF
THE MESSIAH.

7C98A08539174666B126A3B5CB2E6CDD.description: In the Liturgy of the Hours, the Psalms help make connections for daily living.

CF603CF854AB452B90272C0B1F528B8D.description: In the Old Testament and the modern Church, the Psalms are used extensively in worship liturgies.

28B7421E981A45C78172F51432C73182.description:
THE PSALMS WERE SUNG AT THE TEMPLE, IN FAMILY SETTINGS, ON PILGRIMAGES, AND IN THE SOLITUDE OF PERSONAL
PRAYER.

C20A4C2AB21646AB9B72BAF3FDED5D7F.description:
A Foreshadowing of Jesus Christ and the Church can be found in
9 02 1
Old Testament figures, including, but not limited to:

C00DE9D39D084DFC8E2E680B5D5D0D06.description: Examples from Major and Minor Prophets

9C03C25508934804A799499CF458166F.description: Creation & the Fall of Man Genesis 1 :1-3:24

8AC726FEC1C0489D84C207C904956A10.description:
Key Bible Stories that provide a basic foundation to the Old
Testament, include, but are not limited to:

58D3D31833EF476B9158546CD41A81A1.description:
IN THE OLD TESTAMENT GOD SPOKE TO THE PEOPLE THROUGH JUDGES AND KINGS, PRIESTS AND PROPHETS, SAGES
AND POETS.

6832BD0FFAB247A985C6ECB280BCD01D.description: The 10 Commandments are an important way for the People of God to show their faithfulness to God's covenant.

196A4F3E43014024B72DB075C4404D13.description: The 10 Commandments can be found in the book of Exodus 20:2-17 and in Deuteronomy 5:6-21.

2A92F63223784EB6A405B565FD296E6A.description:
Each of the 10 Commandments obliges the People of God to follow faithfully and grow in their relationship with God and his
people.

CC715166A62A41968EF685665AC43F17.description: The 10 Commandments, or Decalogue, are the foundation of the Old Testament Covenant.

FB04F7A2B7214A9B86693969454446B8.description: THE DECALOGUE IS THE 10 COMMANDMENTS GIVEN BY GOD TO MOSES.

D1F0DD37C37E413BB4C9D88E7A0C5AB9.description:
The progression of the Old Testament covenant is comparable to our
own relationship with God.

132699B7421742658F43285DCD14DA10.description: There are various covenants mentioned in the Old Testament.

D769745DD03B4A94AFBFED83F9EDA2DF.description:
A covenant is a solemn agreement between human beings or between God and a human being(s) involving mutual
commitments or guarantees.

26666C3873C1475C884286CD5CD41A54.description: A COVENANT IS A SPECIAL AGREEMENT BETWEEN GOD AND HIS PEOPLE.

27EF4F8CB29A4B3ABEF4A68D9ACD228C.description: The ten plagues that Pharaoh and the Egyptians experienced were: Water Turned into Blood, the Frogs, the Gnats, the Flies,  the Pestilence, the Boils, the Hail, the Locusts, the Darkness,  and the Death of the First-born.

5C80ECF811DB435685468C58C2C4B116.description: The "Call of Moses" in Scripture relates to our Baptismal Call.

8765DD3CC52846178DB4762CC71A3122.description: Passover is a foreshadowing of the events of the Last Supper of Jesus Christ and his disciples.

51F65473871246BDB64FB9574BE68C03.description: The story of Exodus is found in the book of Exodus.

E31F0CA1F0F148F6AF940EFF92DDD4DE.description: THE CENTRAL EVENT-OF THE OLD TESTAMENT IS THE EXODUS.

D60CB1D3D36A42BB9CDE05E26D4C0449.description:
Stories of the Patriarchs within Scripture foreshadow events in
the New Testament especially in the life of Jesus Christ.

7432D90DCF69483F831FD234684491F4.description:
Patriarch is a title given to the venerable ancestors or "fathers" of the Semitic peoples, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, who
received God's promise of election.

98087D26933B45AC811C6B0055561553.description: THE PATRIARCHS ARE ABRAHAM, ISAAC AND JACOB.

9188E736899F4BB0ABED50958B8A2490.description: The Protestant Bible is different from the Catholic Bible due to the removal of several books from the Canon of Scripture.

3F88A7DC0D6B41E9B99C9E3031D2433C.description: The Canon of Scripture includes 46 books for the Old Testament and 27 for the New Testament.

8722DB72B62F428BAB9EA9EE341469BB.description: Passages in Sacred Scripture can be cited by abbreviating the book name and including the chapter and verse numbers.

7103C9E0F7344E0FAC66672207C2804B.description:
THE SYSTEM USED TO REFERENCE SCRIPTURE INCLUDES BOOK NAME, CHAPTER NUMBER AND VERSE NUMBER {EX.
GENESIS 1 :1)

73EA7FAA6DE348E682456CB837C3A9CD.description:
The book of Genesis has two symbolic stories of creation that reveal
God as the source of all life.

39C3F316A889473DB2990C26EBFB81F7.description:
The human authors of Sacred Scripture had various purposes
for the effective use of different literary forms.

B3C0E40EC6DE4A02BA4305B42824483D.description: Different types of literary forms are used in various scripture passages, including, but not limited to:

59D643DE6A4241D28D4AFB0C874EA0EA.description:
THE HUMAN AUTHORS OF THE BOOKS OF THE BIBLE USED MANY DIFFERENT LITERARY FORMS TO CONVEY GOD'S
MESSAGE. THESE INCLUDE HISTORICAL ACCOUNTS, PARABLES, POETRY, LETTERS, ALLEGORIES AND PROVERBS.

632C7ECDA8A848C2AEB8CB5DC83D7804.description: The divinely revealed realities, which are contained and presented in the text of Sacred Scripture, have been written down under the inspiration of the Holy Spirit; therefore, God is the author of Sacred Scripture.

FF2B11B5049547AE814F1C9C6D55853A.description: Scripture and Tradition make up a single Sacred Deposit.

4FD1FF5646C04E2D8647C3EF08340930.description: Jesus Christ is the mediator and is the fullness of all revelation.

84FC0B82F12A4E8FAA7CED390AE445C3.description:
JESUS CHRIST IS THE SUMMIT OF REVELATION. SCRIPTURE AND DIVINE TRADITION MAKE UP A SINGLE DEPOSIT. GOD IS
THE AUTHOR OF SACRED SCRIPTURE.

376E50AF4EC043EA8AD80896C4F9F829.description:
Humans are created in the image and likeness of God with special dignity and the responsibility of being stewards of
creation.

DEBA4EDF8C404DFF98E1ADA5A9F0A8F7.description: The Bible is the inspired Word of God.

A2CA81ED3B644BCB9DB66F30885CE9A4.description:
Sacred Scripture and Apostolic Tradition are modes of Divine
Revelation.

014BD30438E54740B114F3339820EB64.description: Divine Inspiration is the guidance of God the Holy Spirit given to the writers of the Bible.

456D6388AE7643A19E5826F3035FBFC2.description:
The work of the Blessed Trinity in creation is the source of all
life and goodness.

6CE2372ACC544F15828099F531898473.description:
Divine Revelation is relational and calls us to actively receive
what God has first given.

9528914CD8EC49F4ACBE68D0C20C7146.description:
REVELATION IS GOD TELLING US ABOUT HIMSELF, OURSELVES AND THE WORLD AROUND US, AND INVITING US INTO
RELATIONSHIP WITH HIM.

9DC5FC27908B42999DCB68ABC0395628.description: Faith Theme: Introduction to the Bible.

CB220898A92E46EAAFD0796A518B8ECF.description:
Every disciple of Jesus Christ has a responsibility to serve those in need through
corporal and spiritual works of mercy.

02DD343DF696420E85EC4E6E9266578B.description:
JESUS CHRIST TAUGHT US HOW TO TREAT ONE ANOTHER WITH JUSTICE AND MERCY IN ORDER TO TRULY LIVE AS HIS
DISCIPLES.

3618C962FF1B4F20A1B8D3F89FE2EFBE.description:
The Seven Sacraments are celebrated as part of the Liturgical work of the Church and
help the faithful to lead lives directed towards Jesus Christ.

0C771E6837C344548D119B4302BB45FE.description:
The Bishop calls the faithful to "full, active and conscious participation" in the Liturgy; especially, the Sunday Eucharistic Celebration, the central liturgical action of the

09E564CDD41C4AE4A677AA32F08A96D0.description: The Church marks time with a Liturgical Calendar, in order to sanctify our days.

The laity, consecrated religious and ordained ministers are called to join in the work

2A5B35857DD94FB6A48D63C1443E7E73.description: LITURGY IS THE PUBLIC WORK OF THE BODY OF JESUS CHRIST, THE CHURCH.

11189BDAF084400392C6BACAED3977B8.description: The Passion of our Lord Jesus Christ can be found in all four Gospels.

37DB9711D50F4F4898C167B8A4113057.description: The four Gospels proclaim the Good News of Jesus Christ's life, death and resurrection.

The 10 Commandments can be found in the book of Exodus 20:2-17 and
